Rasputin is the only reminder app you'll need from now on.
Rasputin helps you remember all the tasks you need to do, including the deadlines and time.
It's intuitive, easy to learn, ~~fast~~ SUPER fast to use and best of all, it's FREE!
<...> indicates a parameter to be provided by the user.
[...] indicates an optional parameter to be provided by the user.
Adds a task that does not need to be done by any date or time.
You currently have 1 task/s in your list.
Adds a task that has a deadline to be done by.
Deadlines must have a date in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
The time of the deadline is optional and must be in the 24-hour format HHmm.
Example: `deadline return book /by 2024-09-30` or `deadline submit quiz /by 2024-09-28 2200`
You currently have 2 task/s in your list.
You currently have 3 task/s in your list.
Adds an event that has a start time and end time.
Events must have both a date and time for the event start and event end in the format YYYY-MM-DD HHmm.
You currently have 4 task/s in your list.
Marks the task at the given index of the list as done.
The specified task must not be already been marked as done.
Good job! Marked that as done for you.
Marks the task at the given index of the list as not done.
The specified task must not be already been marked as not done.
Undoes the most recent command that can be undone.
Can only be applied to todo, deadline, event, delete, mark and unmark commands.
One of these commands must have been executed to be able to use the undo command.
Most recent command has been undone!
Finds tasks in the list that contains the search keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list.
View all the current tasks in your list.
To exit the application, simply enter `bye` and Rasputin will exit, saving all changes to your list of tasks.
* Represents a chatbot to store a list of tasks for the user.
* Takes in the path of the .txt file containing the list of tasks to be read and written to.
* @param filePath Path of file to be opened.
* Parses the input from the user, executes the command given and returns the bot's output message.
* @param input String input from the user
* Represents the command to add a new task into the TaskList.
public class AddCommand extends Command implements Undoable {
* @param tasks TaskList to execute the adding of task to
* @param input The String input from the user
* Checks the task to be added into the TaskList.

* @return Rasputin's response as a String in case of successful or failed addition.
* @throws RasputinException If task has incorrect parameters such as empty description or invalid time and date.
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! The description of a task cannot be empty.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Deadline tasks require a deadline to be completed by.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Invalid deadline format.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Event tasks require a duration for the event.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Event tasks require a duration for the event.");
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Invalid event duration format.");
* Undoes the command ie. remove the added the task.
* Abstract class to represent commands to be executed in the chatbot.
public abstract String execute() throws RasputinException;
* Represents the command to delete a task from the TaskList.
public class DeleteCommand extends Command implements Undoable {
* @param tasks TaskList to execute the deletion of task
* @param index Index in list to be deleted
* Removes the task at the given index from the TaskList.
* @return Rasputin's response as a String in case of successful or failed deletion.
* @throws InvalidTaskException If the given index is out of bounds of TaskList.
String output = "Done, removed that task for you.\n" + tasks.get(index).toString();
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Task not found.");
* Undoes the command ie. adds back the deleted task.
* Note that the task will end up at the bottom of the TaskList.
* Represents the command to close the program when the user types "bye".
* @param storage Storage to write the TaskList to
* @param tasks TaskList to be written to file
* Writes the TaskList into the .txt file and prints the farewell message.
* Will always return true as program will be terminated.
* Represents a command to find a task with description containing the keyword to search with.
* @param input User's input as a string
* @param tasks TaskList to look for the input keyword
* Searches the TaskList for tasks with descriptions containing the given search keyword.
* If no matching tasks are found, print a message saying no found matches.
* Else, print TaskList of matching tasks.
* @throws RasputinException If command is missing the keyword to search with.
throw new RasputinException("ERROR! Find command requires a keyword to search with.");
String output = String.format("Here are the matching tasks in your list.\n%s", foundTasks.toString());
* Represents an invalid command due to invalid parameters or input.
* @return Error message as a String for the UI.
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
public class MarkCommand extends Command implements Undoable {
* @param tasks TaskList in which the task is to be marked
* @param index Index of task to be marked
* Marks the task at the given index of the TaskList as done.
* @return Rasputin's response as a String in case of successful or failed marking.
* @throws InvalidTaskException If the given index is out of bounds of the TaskList.
String output = "Good job! Marked that as done for you.\n" + tasks.get(index).toString();
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Task not found.");
* Undoes the command ie. unmarks the specified task.
* Represents command to print out the current list of tasks.
* @return List of tasks as a String.
* Undoes the most recent undoable Command.
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! No command to undo!");

public class UnmarkCommand extends Command implements Undoable {

String output = "Task has been unmarked.\n" + tasks.get(index).toString();
throw new InvalidTaskException("ERROR! Task not found.");
* Undoes the command ie. marks the specified task.
